questions.question: What data structures are being discussed in this lecture?
options: Sequences and sets
Linked lists and dynamic arrays
Dynamic arrays and pointers
Arrays and interfaces
questions.correct_answer: Sequences and linked lists or Sequences and dynamic arrays
questions.explanation: The lecture is discussing sequences and either linked lists or dynamic arrays as data structures.

questions.question: What is the difference between an interface and a data structure?
options: An interface is a specification of what data can be stored, while a data structure gives you the actual representation.
A data structure is a specification of what data can be stored, while an interface gives you the actual representation.
An interface is how you do something, while a data structure is what you want to do.
An interface is what you want to do, while a data structure is how you do it.
questions.correct_answer: An interface is how you do something, while a data structure is what you want to do.
questions.explanation: An interface defines the operations that can be performed on a data structure, while a data structure provides the underlying implementation for those operations.

questions.question: Which operation takes linear time in an array?
options: Getting an item by index
Setting an item by index
Inserting an item at the beginning
Deleting an item from the end
questions.explanation: In an array, resizing the array takes linear time.

questions.question: What is a static sequence interface?
options: An interface for sequences that can change size
An interface for sequences that cannot change size
An interface for linked lists
An interface for dynamic arrays
questions.correct_answer: An interface for sequences that cannot change size
questions.explanation: A static sequence interface is an interface for sequences that cannot change size.

questions.question: What are the main data structure tools or approaches mentioned in this lecture?
options: Arrays and pointers
Dynamic arrays and linked lists
Sequences and sets
Interfaces and algorithms
questions.explanation: The main data structure tools or approaches mentioned in this lecture are arrays and pointers.

questions.question: What is the difference between an array and a linked list?
options: An array is a consecutive chunk of memory, while a linked list uses pointers to link items together.
A linked list is a consecutive chunk of memory, while an array uses pointers to link items together.
An array is a data structure that supports constant time get and set operations, while a linked list does not.
A linked list is a data structure that supports constant time get and set operations, while an array does not.
questions.correct_answer: An array is a consecutive chunk of memory, while a linked list uses pointers to link items together.
questions.explanation: An array is a contiguous block of memory, while a linked list uses pointers to connect nodes and create the sequence.

questions.question: What are the main operations supported by the static sequence interface?
options: Build, length, iteration, get, set, insert first, delete last, insert at arbitrary position, delete first, delete last, delete at arbitrary position
Build, length, iteration, get, set, insert last, delete first, insert at arbitrary position, delete last, delete at arbitrary position
Build, length, iteration, get, set, insert first, delete first, insert at arbitrary position, delete at arbitrary position
Build, length, iteration, get, set, insert last, delete last, insert at arbitrary position, delete first, delete at arbitrary position
questions.explanation: The static sequence interface supports the operations build, length, iteration, get, and set.

questions.question: What is the advantage of using a dynamic array over a static array?
options: Dynamic arrays support constant time get and set operations, while static arrays do not.
Static arrays support constant time get and set operations, while dynamic arrays do not.
Dynamic arrays can change size dynamically, while static arrays cannot.
Static arrays can change size dynamically, while dynamic arrays cannot.
questions.correct_answer: Dynamic arrays can change size dynamically, while static arrays cannot.
questions.explanation: Dynamic arrays can resize themselves as needed, making them more flexible than static arrays which have a fixed size.
